document_title: Parkinson's disease: Causes, symptoms and diagnosis
subsection_content:
Parkinson's disease is divided into two groups: primary (idiopathic) and secondary:
1. Primary
More than 80% of Parkinson's disease cases are idiopathic or primary, meaning the cause is unknown. Common signs of the disease include stiffness, slow movements, tremors, etc.
2. Secondary
Secondary Parkinson's disease is divided into 2 subgroups, including:
Vascular Parkinson's disease (arteriosclerosis parkinsonism): According to the Vietnam Neurological Association, vascular Parkinson's disease often has symptoms related to memory, mood and sleep, etc. The disease affects people limited blood supply to the brain. In some cases, patients have mild strokes due to this form of Parkinson's disease.; Parkinson's disease caused by drugs: Some drugs such as sedatives, anti-epileptic drugs, calcium blockers and brain supplements, etc. believed to be a factor leading to Parkinson's disease. However, cases of drug-induced Parkinson's disease usually end within a few days or weeks after finishing taking the drug. A small number of cases will last several months.
